item.description:
Let's Meet up at Charlie's Kitchen Beer Garden, 10 Eliot Street at 1:00PM. At 1:15 PM, walk down Winthrop Street to the festival music stage in Winthrop Park.


The 30th Annual Oktoberfest and Honk! Festival Parade


(Raindate: Monday, October 12th, 2009)



Six stages of live entertainment including a main stage in the Super Crosswalk, A Dance Stage at Holyoke Center on Forbes Plaza, a Club Passim Stage, a Busker Stage, and two Honk Band Stages!



50 plus International Food Vendors! Enjoy authentic Oktoberfest dishes at the Sandrine’s booth featuring Chef Raymond Ost’s world renowned Choucroute, hot soups and Vanilla Crème Brule. Enjoy the ceremonial Keg Tapping and Toast and authentic Bavarian food, beer and costumes at Grendel’s Den.



People watch (and be watched) from a cozy corner of the Grafton Street/Sam Adams Beer Garden (across from the Main Stage)! Grab a seat on a hay-bale inside the Upper Crust Beer Garden along Mount Auburn Street and enjoy a great view of the Honk encampment in Winthrop Park!


Satisfy your every food desire with Chef Jasper White’s Shrimp on Skewers, corn and clam chowder at the Summer Shack booth, and Chef Paul O’Connell’s Cuban Sandwich, delicious healthy burgers at the b. good grill, Korean Bar-b-que, Ben and Jerry’s ice cream, fudge and kettle korn, and international flavors from Café of India and the Midwest Grill, and a host of Thai, Nepalese, Jamaican, Chinese, and Mediterranean booths from which to choose!



Oktoberfest is Free to the Public.

For more info, please call 617-491-3434 or www.harvardsquare.com
item.how_to_find_us: I will disclose my cell number after you rsvp "yes"
item.name: Oktober Fest in Harvard Square
